com.bfg.backend.match

Class AbstractMatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bfg.backend.match.AbstractMatch
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AllOutDeathmatch, TeamDeathmatch

    public abstract class AbstractMatch
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract match implementation. All the basic match functionality implemented here. Tracks connected players
    Author:
    emball

      AbstractMatch()
      Constructor, initializes everything

      • registerHit

        public void registerHit(java.lang.Integer playerId,
                        java.lang.Integer sourceId,
                        boolean causedDeath,
                        java.lang.Integer dmg)
        Registers a hit on a player. Player is damaged, enemy gets damage delt.
        Parameters:
        playerId - The player id associated with the hit
        sourceId - The enemy player id that hit the player
        causedDeath - True or False depending on if player was killed by enemy
        dmg - The amount of damage dealt to the player from the enemy

      • registerKill

        public void registerKill(Player player,
                         Player enemy)
        Registers the death of a player, and adds the kill to the enemy who did the destroying. Player is the one who dies, enemy get the kill point.
        Parameters:
        player - Increments the death count for this player
        enemy - Increments the kill count for the enemy

      • respawn

        public void respawn(java.lang.Integer playerId)
        Finds the player by id and respawns the player in the match
        Parameters:
        playerId - The id of the player that needs to be respawned
